item.title: China’s Manufacturing Is Booming Despite Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: U.S. pressure has only cemented its rival’s status as the world’s indispensable factory floor, sending its trade surplus above $1 trillion.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: Gaza Sits Under 68 Million Tons of Rubble. A Look at the Daunting Task Ahead.
item.description: One way to measure the scale of the damage: If the debris were spread over Manhattan, there would be 215 pounds on every square foot.
item.dc:creator: Emma Brown

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Will Allow Nvidia H200 Chip Sales to China, Get 25% Cut
item.description: The president’s decision to allow exports of the powerful chip comes after meeting last week with the company’s CEO, Jensen Huang.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Whelan

item.title: Opinion | A Trump Doctrine of Contradictions
item.description: His Administration’s new security document is notably soft on Russia and China.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | The Decline of Europe in Gallic Profile
item.description: A new report offers a cautionary tale about runaway entitlements.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: 100 Nigerian Students Freed After Kidnapping at Catholic School
item.description: The Nigerian government said 100 of the students abducted from a Catholic school just over two weeks ago have been freed.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Europe Scrambles for Influence in U.S.-Led Peace Talks on War in Ukraine
item.description: The continent’s leaders are concerned any deal doesn’t leave Kyiv, and the rest of Europe, at risk of future Russian attack.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Opinion | World Trade Grows Without the U.S.
item.description: Other nations are busy expanding commercial ties, as the U.S. economy is increasingly isolated.
item.dc:creator: Donald J. Boudreaux

item.title: German Industrial Output Accelerates Again
item.description: The sector showed further signs of stabilization as it awaits large-scale government investment.
item.dc:creator: Don Nico Forbes

item.title: Hong Kong Election Draws Tepid Turnout After Deadly Fire
item.description: A get-out-the-vote campaign failed to lift turnout much above historic lows in a Hong Kong election in which the ballot was limited to “patriots” vetted by Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: China’s Trade Surplus Tops $1 Trillion, Underscoring Its Export Dominance
item.description: The historic milestone comes as China adds high-end manufacturing strength to its established dominance in lower-end goods.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Cheng

item.title: Trump-Brokered Cease-Fire Crumbles on Thai-Cambodian Border
item.description: The Thai army said it launched airstrikes in response to earlier fire from the Cambodian side.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: Japan Is Out Spending. Bond Markets Seem Nervous About Picking Up the Tab.
item.description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi plans to increase spending as Japan’s central bank is considering raising interest rates.
item.dc:creator: Megumi Fujikawa

item.title: Israel Closes In on Hamas Fighters Trapped in Tunnels, Testing Cease-Fire
item.description: Near-daily exchanges of fire are extending the fighting and creating a roadblock in peace talks.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: For Venezuela’s Machado, Collecting Nobel Peace Prize Could Mean Exile
item.description: If María Corina Machado leaves Venezuela, President Nicolás Maduro may block her return.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: Opinion | Jimmy Lai’s Birthday Gift—to China
item.description: Donald Trump’s visit to Beijing is an opening for the publisher’s release from prison.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Europe’s Foolish War on X.com
item.description: The European Commission proves its critics right by fining Elon Musk’s social platform.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Hong Kong Defends Its Fire Response
item.description: Chris Tang, secretary for security, replies to the editorial board on the Wang Fuk Court fire.

item.title: Chinese Jets Locked Radar on Japanese Fighters
item.description: Tokyo said the incidents in international waters near Okinawa were dangerous, as diplomatic tensions with Beijing simmer.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: See How a Chinese Invasion of Taiwan Could Unfold
item.description: An amphibious invasion would be one of the toughest military operations to pull off. This analysis shows why.
item.dc:creator: Carl Churchill

item.title: China’s Growth Is Coming at the Rest of the World’s Expense
item.description: China is swallowing up a growing share of the world’s market for manufactured goods, revealing an uncomfortable truth: Beijing is pursuing a “beggar thy neighbor” growth model at everyone else’s expense.
item.dc:creator: Greg Ip

item.title: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Targets Even Closest Wartime Allies
item.description: The door is now shut to some 265,000 Afghans waiting to come, many of whom worked with the U.S. or have loved ones who did.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Hong Kong Authorities Summon Foreign Media to Criticize Fire Coverage
item.description: Hong Kong’s national-security office summoned representatives of news organizations including The Wall Street Journal to find fault with coverage of the deadly fire at Wang Fuk Court and warn against reporting that would undermine Hong Kong or its authorities.

item.title: Trump’s National-Security Strategy Softens Language on China
item.description: The White House document maintains some tough talk on Taiwan but drops references to Beijing as America’s main challenger.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Cheng

item.title: U.S. Flips History by Casting Europe—Not Russia—as Villain in New Security Policy
item.description: An annual strategy document, which has described threats from China to Russia, directs some of its harshest language at NATO allies.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Canada’s Carney Says Trump, Sheinbaum Pledge to Work on USMCA
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney held constructive talks with President Trump and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum on the margins of Friday’s World Cup draw in Washington, his spokeswoman said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Four European Countries Boycott Eurovision Song Contest Over Israel
item.description: Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands and Slovenia pull out of next year’s contest to protest Israel not being kicked out.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: Prominent Anti-Hamas Militia Leader Killed in Gaza
item.description: Yasser Abu Shabab led a small Palestinian militia opposing Hamas that was armed by Israel.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: U.A.E.’s Ransom Payment for Kidnapped Prince Bolsters al Qaeda in Mali
item.description: Jihadists received millions of dollars as they blockade the country’s capital and security across the region deteriorates.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Trump’s New National-Security Strategy Takes Aim at Europe
item.description: The document calls for an end to NATO expansion and chastises Europe over “unrealistic expectations” for how to end the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Chinese Forces Battle Dizzying Altitudes to Expand Military Footprint
item.description: A Wall Street Journal analysis of more than 100 satellite images shows clear evidence of the country’s expanding air power and reach.
item.dc:creator: Camille Bressange

item.title: European Leaders Warn Zelensky to Be Wary in U.S. High-Speed Push for Peace
item.description: The Ukrainian leader must secure a solid pledge from Washington before conceding to Russian demands, his counterparts caution.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Israel’s Latest Military Tech: Tested in Gaza, Wanted by the West
item.description: Europeans are looking to Israel’s military technology as the threat from Russia looms, despite criticizing Israeli conduct during the war.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Putin and Modi Deepen Relationship That Has Drawn Trump’s Anger
item.description: The Russian president is embarking on a high-profile visit to India, aiming to protect a partnership that is a crucial for Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: How a Man Convicted of Running a Latin American Narco State Landed a Pardon
item.description: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández’s unusual network of Trump allies and MAGA influencers helped deliver an extraordinary pardon to him.
item.dc:creator: Josh Dawsey

item.title: Ukraine’s Corruption Cops Drip-Feed Probe Details Like an HBO Drama
item.description: Ukraine’s anticorruption bureau is turning theatrical as it competes for attention with news of the front line of Russia’s nearly four-year-old invasion.
item.dc:creator: Anastasiia Malenko

item.title: The World Has More Billionaires Than Ever
item.description: Soaring tech valuations and stock-market gains have boosted the number of billionaires and the wealth they hold.
item.dc:creator: Juliet Chung

item.title: For First Time in Decades, Child Deaths Will Rise This Year
item.description: Almost a quarter of a million more children around the world are projected to die in 2025 than in 2024.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: Drones Fight Other Drones in the Battle for Ukraine’s Skies
item.description: Ukraine is increasingly using interceptors to destroy Russian drones, and its best pilots are often young videogame aces.
item.dc:creator: Ievgeniia Sivorka

item.title: Audit Finds Palestinian Inmates Face Starvation and Beatings in Israeli Prisons
item.description: Conditions have sharply deteriorated since the start of the war in Gaza, according to a report from Israel’s Public Defender’s Office.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Here in Venezuela, People Are More Afraid of Runaway Inflation Than Trump
item.description: Venezuelans are shrugging off threats to oust leader Nicolás Maduro, worrying more about the price of Christmas decorations and an economy in ruins.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: Oil Rises as Peace Talks Are Yet to Yield Results
item.description: Oil futures rose as Russia-Ukraine peace talks had yet to produce results while crude supplies remained elevated.

item.title: Europe Scales Back Plan to Make Massive Loans to Ukraine
item.description: The proposal is aimed at addressing the concerns of Belgium and leaving room for the U.S. to use the funds as a lure for Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Ukraine Goes After Moscow’s Shadow Fleet in International Waters
item.description: Recent strikes are hitting at the core of Russia’s economy, but they are risky, and their ultimate impact is uncertain.
item.dc:creator: James Marson

item.title: China’s Services-Sector Activity Growth Slows
item.description: The RatingDog general services purchasing managers index fell to 52.1, marking the lowest level in five months, according to a statement released Wednesday.

item.title: Marathon Russia-U.S. Meeting Yields No Ukraine Peace Deal
item.description: Territory has emerged as one of the main stumbling blocks to a deal. Russia has demanded that Kyiv cede all of the eastern Ukrainian region of the Donbas.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: ‘Welcome to America!’ Captured Drug Lords Choose: Snitch or Suffer
item.description: Under pressure from the Trump administration, Mexico turned over 55 cartel leaders in a pair of cloak-and-dagger missions.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: In Nigeria, Target of a Trump Threat, Parents Fear for Kidnapped Children
item.description: Fed up with Nigeria’s inability to stop mass abductions of students, families ask the U.S. for assistance.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: U.K. Loosens Bank Capital Demands for First Time Since Financial Crisis
item.description: British banks will no longer need to hold so much capital, as the U.K. joins the U.S. in unwinding some measures put in place after the global financial crisis.
item.dc:creator: Joe Wallace

item.title: U.K. Budget Watchdog Head Quits After Early Report Release
item.description: The head of the U.K.’s budget watchdog resigned after a review found the organization had failed to protect its market-sensitive assessment of government measures from premature access.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Sudan Offers Russia Its First Naval Base in Africa
item.description: A Red Sea port would give Moscow a vital edge in strategically critical waters.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: After ‘Productive’ Meeting With Ukrainian Negotiators in Florida, U.S. Officials Head to Russia
item.description: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner plan to travel to Moscow for more talks about a possible peace plan.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Scotland Wants to Issue Its Own Bonds. Last Time It Paid With Its Independence.
item.description: The first Scottish bonds in over 300 years, already known as “kilts,” could help exorcise the ghosts of the past.
item.dc:creator: James Hookway

item.title: Now Poorer Countries Are Shutting the Door on Refugees Too
item.description: Uganda had been a notable exception to a worldwide pull-up-the-drawbridge trend—until now.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Make Money Not War: Trump’s Real Plan for Peace in Ukraine
item.description: The Kremlin pitched the White House on peace through business. To Europe’s dismay, the president and his envoy are on board.
item.dc:creator: Annie Ng

item.title: U.K. Budget Trims Inflation But Offers Limited Relief for BOE
item.description: The budget is unlikely to cool inflation in a sustained manner that would open the way for many more rate cuts, economists say.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: U.K. Unveils Sweeping New Tax Hikes
item.description: The Treasury chief said the measures, from a tax on more expensive properties to a levy on sweet dairy products such as milkshakes, would patch up public finances.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: School Kidnappings Have Become a Cruel Fact of Life in Nigeria
item.description: President Trump has threatened military intervention to head off what he says is the persecution of Christians, but children of all faiths are abducted, often for money.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Pakistan Points Finger at India Over Suicide Blast
item.description: The accusation came as India’s prime minister vowed to find the perpetrators of a separate deadly explosion on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Car Explosion in India’s Capital Kills Eight
item.description: Indian officials said it was too early to say if the blast was the result of a bomb.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Trump Signals Support for Selling Submarines to Australia
item.description: The president’s comments calmed fears that he would pull out of the Biden-era deal and came as he struck an agreement with the U.S. ally on rare earths.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Pentagon Review of Aukus Security Pact Worries U.K., Australia
item.description: The review throws into doubt a strategic partnership that aims to give Australia nuclear-powered submarines and deter Chinese aggression in the Indo-Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Russia’s Side Quest to Dominate Africa: Hijack a Videogame
item.description: Players in the ‘African Dawn’ videogame are asked to choose a side aligned with either Russia or the West.
item.dc:creator: Sarah E. Needleman

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
